title: Contract Evaluation and Consumer Protection
description: An advanced exploration of contract analysis, evaluation criteria, consumer rights and protections, and strategies for identifying and avoiding unfair contractual terms. Students learn to critically assess contracts in various financial contexts including employment, services, and major purchases.
learning_objectives: Analyze contracts critically to identify favorable and unfavorable terms
Evaluate consumer rights and legal protections in various contractual situations
Identify red flags and unfair contract terms that should raise concerns
Apply contract evaluation strategies to real-world financial agreements
Make informed decisions about entering, negotiating, or declining contractual agreements

skill_builder.title: Contract Analyzer
skill_builder.description: An interactive tool where students analyze real-world contracts, identify problematic clauses, evaluate fairness, and practice making informed decisions about accepting, negotiating, or rejecting contractual terms.
